array.string: It works as OpenHaltRestart, clearing SLP_SMI_EN at start of macOS.
Only necessary if you have a problem shutting down macOS.
Since Clover rev4006 the parameter is always NewWay.
Since Clover rev4006 the parameter OldWay is excluded.
Inserts Method (DTGP) into DSDT. It is required for _DSM methods,
so if you use some other DSDT fix to inject device properties then you
must enable this. No sense to use this method without other fixes.
Provide a set of corrections to DSDT to make your system "Darwin"
to be identified as "Windows 2001", like most ACPI systems. More
ACPI devices will work in this mode. Old way this bit also provide fixes:
FIX_WAK_200000, DeleteUnused_400000, FIX_ACST_4000000,
Adds If(arg=5){} to method _PTS. This trick may repair shutdown
problems for some systems (ASUS).
Adds device MCHC to DSDT. For my board H61M this is obligatory,
else KP. Old way also included AddIMEI_80000.
Adds IRQ(0, 8, 11) to device HPET. Obligatory for OSX <= 10.8,
Mavericks can work without it. Old way also included:
FIX_RTC_20000, FIX_TMR_40000.
Changes the device-id for the LPC chipset device. Needed in very
rare cases for non-standard (for Apple) chipsets, like ICH9.
Deletes IRQ(2) from device IPIC. Helps with a non working Power button.
Adds SMBUS device into DSDT, with some sub-device.
I don't know the reason for the patch but it's advised in many forums.
Never seen any problem with this bit.
This is a very functional patch for video devices. Recommended even if
you don't want to inject properties to the device. When this bit is set other
settings like FakeID will be applied as well. Old way: this patch will affect
all video cards, included embedded Intel GFX.
New way: Intel will be patched separately.
Adds initialization for IDE controllers (not SATA) to prevent panic with it.
Injects the DeviceID from ICH6 to prevent the orange icons problem.
Nowadays this patch looks to be obsolete. It is better to do the kext
binary patch instead.
Adds device Firewire into DSDT if absent and if the device really present.
Safe.
Injects USB devices and their properties for USB-1, USB-2 and USB-3.
No reason not to use this bit.
Injects device and properties for the LAN controller. Also made FakeID
for some known substitutions.
Injects device and properties for the WiFi controller. Also made FakeID
for some known substitutions.
Renames AZAL to HDEF or HDAU. Adds the HMDI device if absent.
Else AppleHDA will not work. Adds the properties "layout-id",
"MaximumBootBeepVolume" and "PinConfigurations"
Adds the HDAU Device, if absent, with some default properties.
This Device is used for IntelHDxxxx Graphics. This is required when
using the /Devices/FakeID/IMEI Key. It does nothing on Core 2 systems.
The Device PNLF is necessary for brightness control. This Patch is
also a good influence on proper Sleep/Wake.
Deletes Devices like Floppy Drive, LPT Port, etc. from the DSDT.
Name ACST functions differently for Apple and ASUS. For ASUS it is for
the AC Adapter state. For Apple it is a replacement for _CST, C-States Table.
To avoid conflicts, it is necessary to rename such functions to something else.
Renames device AC0 to ADP1.
Only patches the "Darwin OS" identification.
IntelGFX Device Patch.
Excludes IRQ(0) from RTC device.
Resolves some Sleep/Wake issues by correcting _S3D Methods.
Excludes IRQ(8) from TMR Device. This is an ancient DOS Device and is
no longer needed in modern computing.
Adds Return(Package(0)) into method _WAK if absent. This Patch
eliminates the warning, but we are unsure if it affects anything else
on a working system.
Some OperationRegions in BIOS DSDT are floating and Values may change
after time due to changes in the BIOS. The presence of floating Regions
makes it impossible to use a custom DSDT because a Region may shift
making it no longer correspond to the current state. This patch is intended
to find all such Regions in the BIOS and correct them in a custom DSDT.
Unnecessary after Clover rev4006. The parameter is always NewWay.
Some OEM DSDT already contains Method(_DSM...) for some devices.
It has another structure, another logic, and another results then we need.
But we can't modify this method, and we can't create own method with the
same name, so DropOEM_DSM was created to drop these OEM _DSM.
Default value is false if using a custom DSDT and true if using BIOS.aml.
Alternatively if you only need to drop the _DSM for certain devices, you
can select any of these individually:
File name of the binary DSDT file to load and inject.
Binary DSDT patching
Rename EHC1 to EH01
EHC1 and EHC2 are typically used by both Macs and PCs to identify the two
EHCI controllers (USB2). By renaming EHC1 to EH01 and EHC2 to EH02,
you can effectively disable the built-in port injectors that match the SMBIOS
you're using.
Note: This is for Intel USB3. Third party USB3 such as Asmedia, NEC /
Renasas are problematic. No solution for these controllers AFAIK.
Definition Credit: RehabMan
http://bit.ly/EHC1toEH01
Some OEM DSDT contains some device with Name (_ADR, 0xFFFF).
This is a big problem as I can convert it to ADR=0 and inject properties
but this is dangerous patch, it may lead to panic on IOPCIFamily.kext.
So this key is proposed which will convert this device to (ADR, 0) and
reused for injection. (FakeID for example).
Drop OEM ACPI tables by signature and // or table identifier.
Additionally, now you can drop tables by their length. Why? Because we
found Acer laptop where all SSDT have the same TableID.
Resolves VT-d (Virtualization Technology for Directed I/O) panics.
Same as /Boot/Arguments "dart=0".
FixHeaders should be in common ACPI section, it is not DSDT-only fix.
The FIX is recommended to all users even if you are not going to fix DSDT.
Anyway the fix is safe.
Old setting inside DSDT fixes remains for backward compatibility
but I recommend to exclude it from those section.
Definition Credit: Slice
http://bit.ly/FixHeaders
Drops all internal SSDT Tables to avoid conflicts when generating an SSDT
for your CPU, which contain P // C-States. Clover can do this automatically
or you can specify an external file, which will be loaded from:
EFI/OEM/[model]/ACPI/patched.
Enable auto generation of processor idle sleep states (C-States).
Enable auto generation of processor power performance states (P-States).

dict.string: Ignore "Kernel Flags" specified in boot configuration file.
Boot macOS in Single User Mode.
Disables VT-d (Virtualization Technology for Directed I/O)
Power Nap Fully Enabled (System fully wakes. Fans on, monitors on, Hourly)

array.string: Power Nap Enabled
NOTES: System Fully wakes, sometimes monitor come on, sometimes not
(don't know why).
Power Nap Enabled
NOTES: Fans & monitors do not come on, system.log show the times the
computer woke from sleep. Time Machine Backup are performed hourly in
sleep mode.

dict.string: Forces Sleep to always use the shutdown // reset method.

array.string: Forces use of pin interrupt instead of msi. Intel Series 7 Chipset only (Panther Point.)
Causes the xHC to defer the management of USB2 ports and their devices to one of
the EHC controllers on the PCH (south-bridge). This option can usually also be
configured in the BIOS for Intel Series 7 chipsets.
Disables some feature for idle-mode on Intel's chip.
DEV NOTE: "I couldn't test this, so I added an option to disable it."
OBSOLETE for macOS >= 10.11.
Disables SIP (System Integrity Protection).
Allows unsigned Kexts to load.
As of macOS El Capitan, the kext-dev-mode boot-arg is now obsolete.
Definition Credit: Apple, bu11etpr00f
http://bit.ly/kext-dev-mode

dict.string: Save log files at every boot.
Set maximum number of lines for log file, default 0 (no Limit).
Set the path for the log files to be saved.
Mount EFI partition at every boot or from disk X (X = disk number).

array.string: Only needed for macOS = 10.8

dict.string: Enable debug printing in Lilu and all loaded plugins (available in DEBUG binaries).
Enable Lilu and all loaded plugins on unsupported os versions (use very carefully).
Enable WhateverGreen on unsupported macOS (<=10.13 supported by default).
Enable DVI transmitter correction (required for 290X, 370, etc.).
Force-compat property to ignore compatibility check in NVDAStartupWeb.
Enable-hdmi20 property to enable HDMI 2.0 patches.

array.string: Defaults to PBR; but could also be LegacyBiosDefault or PBRtest. It's just the method
of legacy booting, it probably won't make a difference. For some users using another
method could fix legacy booting. (info by apianti)
Enable specific Processor power state, C2.
Enable specific Processor power state, C3.
Enable specific Processor power state, C4.
Enable specific Processor power state, C6.
Enable specific Processor power state, C7.
VBoxHfs
Rev 4719
Added prelang kbd option if want to keep language when updating macOS
with native NVRAM.
- This is the key to fixing macOS language problems when using native NVRAM.
- This is macOS bug for long time ago.
- When using only AptioMemoryFix or OsxAptioFixV3 without emuvariableuefi.efi
- When using a language other than English
Definition Credit: Sherlocks
http://bit.ly/KbdPrevLang
Rev 4644
A possibility to choose between Light and Dark embedded themes.
Definition Credit: Slice
http://bit.ly/EmbeddedThemeType
Needed for unsupported GPU's to get full resolution // QE. If set to Yes, e.g. nVidia
GeForce 450 GTS becomes EVGA nVidia GeForce 450 GTS (if supported).
/System/Library/Extensions/AppleHDA.kext
/Extra/Extensions

dict.string: Allow booting with a MacPro4,1 or MacPro5,1 SMBIOS definition without ECC memory
Enable TRIM for non-Apple SSD (from config-sample)
Disable USB Port Limit 10.13.4+ by PMHeart & FredWst
Fresco FL1009 USB 3.0 Device ID Patch by bu11etpr00f
AppleAHCIPort patch to fix internal disks displayed as external (Orange Icon) by Slice (from config-sample)

array.string: AsusAICPUPM key was renamed to AppleIntelCPUPM.
Some vendors, like ASUS, restrict the use of MSR register 0xE2 in their power
management module to ReadOnly. On Sandy // Ivy Bridge systems the kext
AppleIntelCpuPowerManagement will try to write to this register and cause a
kernel panic. This patch will eliminate the kext's write operations.
macOS has compatibility issues with a BIOS CMOS resulting in its reset on each
wake after sleep and reboot, which is noticeable in a loss of BIOS settings. Mostly
Gigabyte motherboards are affected. Usually it can be solved by patching
Device(RTC) in the DSDT.
If this does not help, the kext itself can be patched, which is done here.
Deprecated, this patch can't be OS dependent. Please see:
/KernelAndKextPatches/KextsToPatch/ATI Connector Patch - New Way
Deprecated, this patch can't be OS dependent. Please see:
/KernelAndKextPatches/KextsToPatch/ATI Connector Patch - New Way
Deprecated, this patch can't be OS dependent. Please see:
/KernelAndKextPatches/KextsToPatch/ATI Connector Patch - New Way
Optional Setting:
See #KernelAndKextPatches-EXAMPLES
NO DESCRIPTION ON WIKI (from config-sample.plist)
Enables detailed output describing the patching process. This prints kernel
patches and kext injection debug messages to the screen, since standard boot log
is already closed. Useful for debugging purposes.

dict.string: Fake CPUID is intended to be a replacement for the "KernelCpu" Patch.
It influences the kernel and AppleCPUPowerManagement as well.
If you want to install OSX with an unsupported CPU then you'll need to fake its ID
to avoid kernel panics. Useful if you're trying to install OSX with an Atom CPU, or
For these cases Clover allows you to set FakeCPUID in config.plist or even through
the GUI, in the Binaries patching menu.
Eliminates kernel panics related to an Unsupported CPU like Yonah, Atom or
Haswell for old systems. However, the kernel has other algorithms which will not
work correctly when using an unsupported CPU and this patch will not solve all
problems. It is highly unlikely that this will work with a Pentium M, Pentium 4 or
and AMD. The use of a special replacement kernel is advised in such cases.
Haswell-E setups are currently not supported by the OS X kernel (as of macOS
10.10.2). This patch gets rid of the blocking compatibility checks.
Note: this will NOT enable Power Management or similar features.

array.string: Optional Setting for Ivy Bridge.
NO DESCRIPTION ON WIKI (from config-sample.plist)
Optional Setting for HP Notebooks:
HP Notebooks have lapic problems, which can be solved by using
/Boot/Arguments "cpus=1" or by using this option.
Disables CFG-Lock
NOTE: if not manually specified as false, KernelPm=true will be automatically
applied by Clover when MSR 0xE2 is detected as locked.
If you're using an HWP enabled SMBIOS, you will also need to use the
config.plist _xcpm_idle patch in /KernelAndKextPatches/KernelToPatch.
Definition Credit: RehabMan
Optional Setting for Haswell:
Kernel power management patch for Haswell with locked msrs. Works with
10.8.5 and 10.9 kernels.
Haswell CPU's include Xeon v3 (E3 // E5 // E7) and Core iX (Gen4 // Gen5)
Optional Setting:
See #KernelAndKextPatches-EXAMPLES
Force load // injext Kexts (and plugins) from a booted Volume so they can be patched.
Specifying a directory will force load // inject all contained Kext.
Optional Setting:
See #KernelAndKextPatches-EXAMPLES
Aside from the patches already built into Clover, you also have the ability to
create your own by providing the following data:
The "Name" of the binary file.
The "Find" data in hexadecimal.
The "Replace" data in hexadecimal.
The data length must be equal. A smaller replacement data line can
be filled with zeroes.
NOTE: Patching is applied to the Cache. If you are patching an Info.plist
which is not yet present in the Cache, you will need to reboot twice.
First with the Key "NoCaches" to allow FSInject to load the Kext,
and a second time for the Cache to be Patched successfully.
Optional Setting for AMD Video Cards:
See #KernelAndKextPatches-EXAMPLES
This way you can create several patches for different OSes.
10.6-10.7 ATI6000Controller
10.8-10.12 AMD6000Controller
For a fully working AMD Video Card injecting properties into the registry is
not enough. Additionally a modification of the connectors in the according
controller binary file is necessary.
Definition Credit: bcc9 on insanelymac.
http://bit.ly/AMDPatch
(Since revision r3259)
NO DESCRIPTION ON WIKI
Since revision r3259
Controls System Integrity Protection (SIP)
Relevant user options for SIP:
0x0 = SIP Enabled (Default)
0x3 = SIP Partially Disabled (Allows unsigned Kexts to load. )
0x67 = SIP Disabled completely
Definition Credit: Apple, outdated Clover Wiki
This Value is the Platform UUID or Hardware UUID (Universally Unique Identifier)
shown in macOS in System Information under Hardware Overview.
NOTE: iCloud // iMessage functionality requires each of the following Keys to be
enabled with uniquely generated Values:
/RtVariables/ROM = Platform // Hardware UUID
/SMBIOS/BoardSerialNumber = Serial Number (processor tray)
/SMBIOS/SerialNumber = Serial Number (system)
/SMBIOS/SmUUID = System UUID
/SystemParameters/InjectSystemID = System UUID
Twelve hexadecimal digits, often corresponding to the unique MAC Address of
your Ethernet Card. According to several reports this value can also be random.
Since revision 3051 Clover can detect the LAN MAC address of an ethernet
device and use it as ROM.
For UEFI, it will first check the UEFI protocol for LAN information; but for legacy
it will attempt to get it from the hardware instead, and because this procedure is
dangerous, you'll need to enable the functionality by specifying the LAN device
with: UseMacAddr0 or UseMacAddr1
(up to 4 devices are calculated but only 2 will be used).
Definition Credit: bu11etpr00f
This group of parameters is used to mask your PC as a Mac. Clover will do this
task automatically based on the given processor, video card and signs of mobility.
However, you may choose differently. Get the MacTracker application, choose a
model you like and find matching values. Clover Configurator can help you with
this task. There is not much to comment here, these values are not for beginners.
If you know them - change them; otherwise leave it. Calculating them is mostly
not possible.

dict.string: Use uuidgen in Terminal to generate a new random UUID to use for this Value.

array.string: PREREQUISITE: /SystemParameters/InjectSystemID MUST be defined, and enabled,
for this Key to function correctly.
The purpose of these two Keys are to provide an way for Users to specify, or
continue using thier existing (Chameleon) System UUID.
Use uuidgen in Terminal to generate a new random UUID to use for this Value, or
use your existing (Chamelon) System UUID.
This is the System UUID (Universally Unique Identifier), which is written into the
SMBIOS table. This Value found in registry at IODeviceTree:/efi/platform>system-id.
***This Value IS NOT the Hardware UUID displayed in macOS System Information***
NOTE: iCloud // iMessage functionality requires each of the following Keys to be
enabled with uniquely generated Values:
/RtVariables/ROM = Platform // Hardware UUID
/SMBIOS/BoardSerialNumber = Serial Number (processor tray)
/SMBIOS/SerialNumber = Serial Number (system)
/SMBIOS/SmUUID = System UUID
/SystemParameters/InjectSystemID = System UUID
Definition Credit: bu11etpr00f

dict.string: Use Clover Configurator to generate a new unique SN to use for this Value.

array.string: Can be automatically generated by Clover Configurator SMBIOS Selection.
This Value IS the Serial Number (system) shown in macOS
in System Information under Hardware Overview.
This Value IS NOT the Serial Number (processor tray) shown in macOS
in System Information under Hardware Overview.
NOTE: iCloud // iMessage functionality requires each of the following Keys to be
enabled with uniquely generated Values:
/RtVariables/ROM = Platform // Hardware UUID
/SMBIOS/BoardSerialNumber = Serial Number (processor tray)
/SMBIOS/SerialNumber = Serial Number (system)
/SMBIOS/SmUUID = System UUID
/SystemParameters/InjectSystemID = System UUID
Definition Credit: bu11etpr00f
Can be automatically generated by Clover Configurator SMBIOS Selection.
SMBIOS.table2>SerialNumber
This Value IS the Serial Number (processor tray) shown in macOS
in System Information under Hardware Overview.
This Value IS NOT the Serial Number (system) shown in macOS
in System Information under Hardware Overview.
NOTE: iCloud // iMessage functionality requires each of the following Keys to be
enabled with uniquely generated Values:
/RtVariables/ROM = Platform // Hardware UUID
/SMBIOS/BoardSerialNumber = Serial Number (processor tray)
/SMBIOS/SerialNumber = Serial Number (system)
/SMBIOS/SmUUID = System UUID
/SystemParameters/InjectSystemID = System UUID
Definition Credit: bu11etpr00f

dict.string: Motherboard or Computer Model // SN // Service Tag

array.string: SMBIOS.table3>AssetTag
This field is never used with real Macs. We can use it for our own purposes.
e.g. in the HWSensors project.
Clover will automatically detect the mobility of a system; e.g. if is powered by
a battery, or requires energy saving or not. You can change this Value to trick
the system into thinking that a battery is not available, or otherwise.
Used to give priority to memory descriptor values found in SMBIOS or SPD.
Change if your memory is described incorrectly in macOS System Information.
"AAPL,slot-name" injector. It allows you to inject Device information into
the PCI section in macOS System Information.
This injection requires "Name (_SUN, 0x02)" to be present
in the Device's DSDT section.
For now, this Value can only be: ATI, NVidia, LAN, WIFI or Firewire.
Must be the same number defined in your DSDT in "_SUN".
The string you want to assign to "AAPL,slot-name".
Set to 0 for PCI, 1 for PCIe 1x, 2 for PCIe 2x ... 16 for PCIe 16x, etc.
Inject custom memory module tables into SMBIOS if original SPD and SMBIOS
provide incorrect or incomplete information.
Number of Hardware Channels supported by your Memory Chipset.
Usually 2 for 16-32GB Max; 4 for 64GB Max. See Motherboard Documentation.
Array of INSTALLED Memory Modules. Don't add Entries for EMPTY Slots.
The Memory Module's Speed in Megahertz.
The Memory Module's Part Number Identifier.
The Memory Module's Size in Megabytes.
The Physical Slot Locate in which the Memory Module is
installed. (e.g. 0-7)
The Memory Module's Serial Number.
The Memory Module's Type.
The Memory Module's Manufacturer Name.
Total count of memory slots in your system. Max 24 (for now).
SMBIOS.table1>ProductName
Setting this value will enable Clover to automatically generate dependent
parameters related to the model specified, so you can leave them out.
NOTE: Custom values will be preferred over generated ones.
Generated Values: BiosReleaseDate, BiosVendor, BiosVersion, Board-ID,
BoardManufacturer, BoardType, BoardVersion, ChassisManufacturer, ChassisType,
Family, FirmwareFeatures, FirmwareFeaturesMask, LocationInChassis,
Manufacturer, PlatformFeature, Version
Clover has built-in definitions for following models:
MacBook1,1 MacBook2,1 MacBook4,1 MacBook5,1 MacBook5,2
MacBook6,1 MacBook7,1 MacBook8,1 MacBook9,1 MacBook10,1
MacBookPro5,1 MacBookPro5,2 MacBookPro5,3 MacBookPro5,4
MacBookPro5,5 MacBookPro6,1 MacBookPro6,2 MacBookPro7,1
MacBookPro8,1 MacBookPro8,2 MacBookPro8,3 MacBookPro9,1
MacBookPro9,2 MacBookPro10,1 MacBookPro10,2 MacBookPro11,1
MacBookPro11,2 MacBookPro11,3 MacBookPro11,4 MacBookPro11,5
MacBookPro12,1 MacBookPro13,1 MacBookPro13,2 MacBookPro13,3
MacBookPro14,1 MacBookPro14,2 MacBookPro14,3 MacBookPro15,1
MacBookPro15,2
MacBookAir3,1 MacBookAir3,2 MacBookAir4,1 MacBookAir4,2
MacBookAir5,1 MacBookAir5,2 MacBookAir6,1 MacBookAir6,2
MacBookAir7,1 MacBookAir7,2
Macmini2,1 Macmini3,1 Macmini4,1 Macmini5,1 Macmini5,2 Macmini5,3
Macmini6,1 Macmini6,2 Macmini7,1
iMac8,1 iMac10,1 iMac11,1 iMac11,2 iMac11,3 iMac12,1 iMac12,2
iMac13,1 iMac13,2 iMac13,3 iMac14,1 iMac14,2 iMac14,3 iMac14,4
iMac15,1 iMac16,1 iMac16.2 iMac17,1 iMac18,1 iMac18,2 iMac18,3
iMacPro,1,
MacPro3,1 MacPro4,1 MacPro5,1 MacPro6,1

Used as an indirect indication for platform mobility. Clover will use a value
according to the set Mac model, like it is used in real Macs.
The effect, except mobility settings, is unclear.
Automatically generated by the /SMBIOS/ProductName Key Value, or

Equal to model without model number.

Automatically generated by the /SMBIOS/ProductName Key Value, or

Automatically generated by the /SMBIOS/ProductName Key Value, or
Can be automatically generated by Clover Configurator SMBIOS Selection.
Global Policy. This Key regulates Kext Injection.
Yes or <true/> - Always inject kexts from EFI/CLOVER/kexts/
No or <false/> - Never inject kexts
Detect - Kexts from EFI/CLOVER/kexts/ will be injected only if FakeSMC is not
present in the kernelcache.
Any conflicting Value defined in any "Custom Entries" will
override this Setting.
NOTE: This Key MUST be defined, and enabled, in order to use the Key:
/SMBIOS/SmUUID
The purpose of these two Keys are to provide an way for Users to specify, or
continue using thier existing (Chameleon) System UUID.
Use uuidgen in Terminal to generate a new random UUID to use for the
/SMBIOS/SmUUID Value, or use your existing (Chamelon) System UUID.
This is the System UUID (Universally Unique Identifier), which is written into the
SMBIOS table. This Value found in registry at IODeviceTree:/efi/platform>system-id.
***This Value IS NOT the Hardware UUID displayed in macOS System Information***
NOTE: iCloud // iMessage functionality requires each of the following Keys to be
enabled with uniquely generated Values:
/RtVariables/ROM = Platform // Hardware UUID
/SMBIOS/BoardSerialNumber = Serial Number (processor tray)
/SMBIOS/SerialNumber = Serial Number (system)
/SMBIOS/SmUUID = System UUID
/SystemParameters/InjectSystemID = System UUID
Global Policy. If enabled, this Key will force the Cache to be skipped during
each boot. Any conflicting Value defined in any "Custom Entries" will
override this Setting.
Global Policy. If enabled, this Key will enable macOS >= 10.12 to load and use
NVIDIA's WebDriver Ketxts.
Definition Credit:
